content.description: The best v5 at HCR.  Start sitting, and climb up and slightly right through the overhanging wall.  The hardest moves are before you get to the blunt lip, but the most technical moves are turning the lip and topping out.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter.
content.location: Probably the first boulder you will come to when you get to the Crescent area.  Look for a steep wall with edges and pockets.

content.description: Start on an obvious set of holds, just right of the tree. Work right into a compression sequence, before climbing up in the dihedral for a semi-highball finish.
content.location: On the east side of the War Bonnet Boulder, about 10 feet right of Ruthless Aréte, and is visible from the Loaf Boulder.

content.description: Shares the start with "The Crescent" but moves left to a side-pull-rail and traverses across two horizontal ledges before topping out to the right of the arête. This problem could use some traffic to finish cleaning it up. The finish is a bit tall.
content.location: South Idaho's, Near "War Bonnet" and "The Crescent". Downclimb the back side of the boulder near "War Bonnet" and a fallen tree.

content.description: sit starts on arete just right of Warbonnet move up arete and left onto steep face.

One of the most rewarding boulders to top. Intimidating, difficult, long, and a whole lot of fun. If you like highballs, this is a must. The climb begins on the right side of the arete. Start seated on the far right side of a positive rail. Traverse into the tricky lower crux that is managing some slopers and sticking the arete. Once you finagle your body around the arete, you'll find yourself compressing through some crimps out left and that comfortable, tacky corner. There will be a rest jug about 20 feet up, and one last long lock off blocking the deep sigh of relief that awaits you on the chill topout.
content.location: This is located on the far opposite corner of the same giant boulder that the popular War Bonnet V5 holds. To approach, walk from The Loaf Boulder hangout area to and past War Bonnet and then through the triangular arch that reveals The Crescent V3. With The Crescent on your right, turn left and follow along the tall face for 20 feet. The intimidating arete with an orange triangle on the bottom right corner is what you'll be wrestling.

content.description: SS on crimps, climb to top-out finish
SS at pinch on the arete.  Go up the arete and then big to the lip.  Top out the same as Dirty Bitch (V3).
content.location: Start on arete left of Dirty Bitch (V3) with same top out as DB.

content.description: Everyone loves The Crescent!  This is another must-do for climbers who work this grade range.  Start standing, and edge and step carefully to the finish up and right.     If you are 5'8" or taller, you can find a secret way that makes it feel v1.  Extra points for those that are shorter.
content.location: Down, through the cleft past Warbonnet.  Look for the chalked slabby wall.

content.description: SS on crimp and climb sloper to sloper top-out
A cluster of great problems centered around Warbonnet, v5, and The Crescent, v3, two of the better moderates at the ranch. Good landings and perfect rock are what it's about here.
